intro: Varronia ramirezii, commonly known as Ramirez's varronia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
